message_1: Let X be a Fano variety of dimension n such that the anticanonical divisor -K_X has degree d. Find the degree of the canonical divisor K_X in terms of n and d.
message_2:
The canonical divisor K_X is the negative of the anticanonical divisor -K_X. Therefore, the degree of the canonical divisor K_X is the negative of the degree of the anticanonical divisor -K_X.

So, if the degree of -K_X is d, then the degree of K_X is -d.
